page.title: 09Farming in Long Marton
page.content: Farming is mostly mixed farming,cattle for milk and beef,sheep for wool and meat,crops such as barley and wheat and root crops like potatoes and turn- ips. The nearest farm to the school is Midtown Farm,owned by the Bellas fam- ily.There have been Bellas's in Long Marton since the family came over with William the Conqueror and settled land in this area. Some farmers use the old oblong bales for hay and put their silage in- to pits,but more and more farmers are using the round bale method for hay and silage. A round bailer twists the hay or silage into a huge cylinder shape.An- other machine with a spike pick it up and two men put a plastic bag over the bale.The neck is tied with bailer twine and the bales are then stored.
